section.title: Glossaries
section.para: Glossaries are terminology files stored in the folder.
All terms in a segment with a match in any of the glossaries will be displayed in the pane.
Source terms can be multi-word expressions.
There are 2 kinds of glossary files:

listitem.para: Use to enter new terms in this glossary. It is called the writable glossary for this reason.
Use to directly access it. You can then open it in a text editor and modify it.
You do not need to prepare the file in advance.
It will be created the first time you add an entry to the glossary.

note.para: If you choose to use an existing file as the default glossary, all new entries will be recorded in tab-separated format and saved in UTF-8 by default.

listitem.para: They are terminology files in a format recognized by OmegaT. You cannot modify them from the OmegaT interface like the project glossary, but you can do so in a text editor.

note.para: Modifications made to any glossary are immediately recognized by OmegaT displayed in the pane.

section.title: The glossaries folder
section.para: By default, each project contains a folder to store the writable glossary and any reference glossaries you want to add to the project. See the project property for details.
All glossaries must be located in the folder. Glossaries located in nested folders are also recognized.
Within that reference glossaries folder, you can create multiple terminology subfolders organized by topic, client, or any other category that suits your workflow.

Use the project property to set the location of the reference glossaries folder. This folder can be set outside the project, enabling you to use it, or one of the specific subfolders, in other projects.

section.title: Project glossary
section.para: The writable project glossary is located in the folder by default and called .
You can change its name and location in the dialog, but you must give it a .txt or .utf8 extension, and store it within the folder or in one of its subfolders.

section.title: File format
section.para: OmegaT glossary files are simple plain text files containing three-column lists, with the source term in the first column, an optional target term in the second column, and an optional comment in the third column.
Glossaries can be “tab-separated values” (TSV) or “comma-separated values” (CSV) files or can also use the TermBase eXchange (TBX 2) format.

A writable glossary created for the project by OmegaT will be a TSV file saved in UTF-8. User-created files that use only latin characters may be recognized and treated as ISO-8859-1 if it does not contain non-ASCII characters or other characters interpreted as UTF-8.
